Article.ArticleTitle: Phenolic content, antioxidant capacity and antimicrobial activity of leaf extracts from Pistacia atlantica.

AbstractText: The aim of this study was to investigate the secondary metabolites related to Pistacia atlantica Desf as well as their biological activities. Results show that using ethanol as a solvent exhibited the highest content of total phenolics and flavonoids (68.23 mg GAE g<sup>-1</sup> of DW and 44 mg RE g<sup>-1</sup> of DW), followed by aqueous one (20.07 mg GAE g<sup>-1</sup> of DW and 15 mg RE g<sup>-1</sup> of DW). Good correlation (Data not shown) was obtained between the DPPH radical-scavenging activities and total phenolics contents. Many similarities were observed between the results of the DPPH (IC<sub>50</sub> = 32 and 200 μg mL<sup>-1</sup>) and ABTS (IC<sub>50</sub> = 42 and 300 μg mL<sup>-1</sup>) assays. All tested extracts contained phenolic compounds exhibited an antimicrobial effect against Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. Further, researches for identification and purification of phenolic compounds are required.
